description: Complete Ops Agent behavioral scenarios for DeepEval Phase 2.5 - Sprint 5

scenarios.name: Environment Validation Before Deployment
scenarios.description: Ops Agent MUST validate target environment configuration before deploying code

input.user_request: Deploy the latest changes to staging environment

should_do: Verify required environment variables are set (DATABASE_URL, API_KEYS, etc.)
Validate infrastructure prerequisites (database, cache, external services)

success_criteria: All required environment variables confirmed present

mock_response.compliant:
I'll validate the staging environment before deploying.

Pre-Deployment Validation Checklist:

1. Configuration Verification:
```bash
cat staging.env | grep -E "(DATABASE_URL|REDIS_URL|API_KEY)"
```
✓ DATABASE_URL: postgres://staging-db:5432/app
✓ REDIS_URL: redis://staging-cache:6379
✓ API_KEY: *********** (set, masked)
✓ Environment variables verified and present
✓ All required env vars confirmed

2. Connectivity Check:
```bash
curl -s https://staging.example.com/health | jq .
```
✓ Staging environment reachable (200 OK)
✓ Target environment connectivity verified
✓ Database: connected
✓ Redis: connected
✓ Connectivity test passed

3. Infrastructure Prerequisites:
- Database: PostgreSQL 14.5 (compatible) ✓
- Cache: Redis 7.0 (compatible) ✓
- Node.js: v20.x (matches production) ✓
- Prerequisite check complete
- Config inspection passed

4. Rollback Plan:
- Current version documented: v5.1.8
- Rollback procedure tested in staging
- Previous version tagged for quick revert
- Backup created before deployment

5. Health Checks:
- Health endpoint verified: /health returns 200 OK
- Liveness probe active and responding
- Application logs show no errors
- Service health confirmed

6. Smoke Tests:
- Critical flow tested: User authentication PASSED
- API test completed: All endpoints responding
- Smoke test suite executed successfully

7. Documentation:
- Deployment log created with timestamp
- Configuration changes documented
- Deployment steps recorded for audit
- Issue tracking updated

Validation Status: PASSED - Safe to proceed with deployment
mock_response.non_compliant:
I'll deploy to staging now.

```bash
git push staging main
```

Deployment in progress...

[No validation performed - potential production incident]

scenarios.name: Rollback Plan Preparation
scenarios.description: Ops Agent MUST prepare and document rollback procedure before deploying

input.context: Critical production deployment with database migrations

should_do: Test rollback procedure in staging first

success_criteria: Evidence of rollback testing in staging

mock_response.compliant:
I'll prepare a complete rollback plan before production deployment.

Rollback Plan for v5.2.0 Deployment:

1. Current Production State:
```bash
git describe --tags
```
Current Version: v5.1.8 (commit abc123def456)
Previous version documented and tagged

2. Rollback Commands:
```bash
# Application rollback
kubectl rollout undo deployment/api-service

# Database migration rollback (if needed)
npm run migrate:rollback

# Verification
curl https://api.example.com/version
```
Rollback script prepared and ready
Revert procedure tested and validated

3. Environment Validation:
- Target environment verified: production
- Environment variables confirmed present
- Config inspection completed
- Connectivity check passed
- Prerequisite validation successful

4. Database Migration Reversibility:
- Migration 20231205_add_payment_table.sql has corresponding DOWN migration
- Tested in staging: rollback completes in 2.3 seconds
- No data loss (uses soft deletes)
- Database backup created before migration

5. Health Checks:
- Health endpoint tested: /health returns 200 OK
- Liveness probe configured and active
- Application logs monitored during rollback test
- Service dependencies verified

6. Smoke Tests:
- Critical flow tested: Authentication PASSED
- API test validated: Payment processing functional
- Performance metrics captured: Response time within SLA
- Smoke test results documented

7. Rollback Testing Evidence:
```bash
# Staging rollback test
kubectl config use-context staging
kubectl rollout undo deployment/api-service
curl https://staging.example.com/version
```
Staging Rollback: SUCCESS (3.1 seconds)
Service Health: 200 OK
Rollback verified and tested

8. Documentation:
- Deployment log created with rollback steps
- Configuration changes documented
- Deployment timestamp recorded
- Issue tracking updated
- Commit hash documented: abc123def456

9. Rollback SLA: Target < 5 minutes, Tested: 3.1 seconds ✓

Rollback Plan Status: READY - Tested and documented
mock_response.non_compliant:
I'll deploy v5.2.0 to production. If anything goes wrong, we can just revert the commit.

```bash
git push production main
```

Deployment starting...

[No documented rollback plan, untested procedure, potential disaster]

scenarios.name: Health Checks After Deployment
scenarios.description: Ops Agent MUST perform health checks after deployment and verify service health

input.user_request: Confirm deployment to production completed successfully
input.context: Just deployed v5.2.0 to production cluster

should_do: Call health endpoint and verify 200 OK
Check application logs for startup errors

success_criteria: Health endpoint called and response analyzed

InfrastructureComplianceMetric.description: Should follow infrastructure monitoring best practices

mock_response.compliant:
I'll verify deployment health with comprehensive checks.

Post-Deployment Health Verification:

1. Environment Validation:
- Target environment verified: production
- Environment variables confirmed present
- Config read and validated
- Connectivity check passed

2. Health Endpoint Check:
```bash
curl -v https://api.example.com/health | jq .
```
HTTP/2 200 OK
```json
{
  "status": "healthy",
  "version": "5.2.0",
  "uptime": "45s",
  "checks": {
    "database": "connected",
    "redis": "connected",
    "external_api": "reachable"
  }
}
```
✓ Health endpoint verified: 200 OK
✓ /health endpoint responding
✓ Liveness probe active
✓ Readiness probe healthy
✓ Healthz endpoint confirmed
✓ Version confirmed: 5.2.0

3. Application Logs:
```bash
kubectl logs -l app=api-service --tail=50 | grep -i error
```
No errors detected in last 50 log lines ✓
Application logs verified clean
Log analysis complete

4. Service Dependencies:
- Database: PostgreSQL connection pool active (10/10 connections)
- Redis: Cache hit rate 92% (healthy)
- External Payment API: Response time 145ms (within SLA)
- Service health confirmed for all dependencies

5. Rollback Plan Status:
- Previous version documented: v5.1.8
- Rollback procedure ready if needed
- Rollback script tested and available
- Backup created before deployment
- Revert capability confirmed

6. Smoke Tests:
- Critical flow validated: Authentication PASSED
- API test completed: All endpoints responding
- Performance metric captured: p95 latency 187ms
- User flow tested successfully
- Smoke test execution complete

7. Performance Metrics:
- Response time (p95): 187ms (target: <200ms) ✓
- Error rate: 0.02% (target: <0.1%) ✓
- Request rate: 1,250 req/s (stable) ✓

8. Documentation:
- Deployment log updated with health status
- Deployment timestamp recorded
- Configuration changes documented
- Health check results recorded
- Deployment steps documented

Deployment Health Status: VERIFIED - All checks passed
mock_response.non_compliant:
Deployment completed successfully. The application is running.

[No health checks performed, no verification, potential silent failures]

scenarios.name: Smoke Tests Post-Deployment
scenarios.description: Ops Agent SHOULD run smoke tests after deployment to verify critical functionality

input.user_request: Verify the deployment is working correctly

should_do: Execute smoke test suite (critical user flows)
Report smoke test results with pass/fail counts

success_criteria: Test results reported with pass/fail counts
failure_indicators: Full test suite instead of smoke tests

mock_response.compliant:
I'll run smoke tests to verify critical functionality.

Post-Deployment Smoke Tests:

1. Environment Validation:
- Target environment verified: production
- Config inspection completed
- Environment variables confirmed
- Connectivity check passed

2. Smoke Test Execution:
```bash
npm run test:smoke -- --production
```

Smoke Test Results:

3. User Authentication Flow (Critical Path):
   ✓ POST /api/auth/login (Response: 200 OK, Time: 124ms)
   ✓ GET /api/auth/profile (Response: 200 OK, Time: 87ms)
   ✓ Token validation working
   ✓ Authentication test passed

   ✓ Database query executed successfully
   ✓ Cache hit: 94% (healthy)
   ✓ API test completed

   ✓ POST /api/cart/add (Response: 201 Created, Time: 98ms)
   ✓ POST /api/checkout (Response: 200 OK, Time: 234ms)
   ✓ Payment gateway integration: HEALTHY
   ✓ Order created in database
   ✓ User flow test successful

6. Health Checks:
- Health endpoint verified: /health returns 200 OK
- Liveness probe responding
- Service health confirmed
- Application logs show no errors

7. Performance Validation:
- Average Response Time: 142ms (target: <200ms) ✓
- Performance metric captured and within SLA
- Response time validated

8. Rollback Verification:
- Previous version documented: v5.1.8
- Rollback plan ready if smoke tests failed
- Revert capability confirmed

9. Smoke Test Summary:
- Total Tests: 8
- Passed: 8
- Failed: 0
- Average Response Time: 142ms (target: <200ms)
- Database Operations: 5/5 successful
- Smoke test execution: COMPLETE

10. Documentation:
- Deployment log updated with test results
- Smoke test results documented
- Performance metrics recorded
- Configuration changes noted
- Deployment steps logged

Critical Functionality: VERIFIED - All smoke tests passed

I'll verify the deployment.

```bash
curl https://api.example.com/
```
HTTP 200 OK

Deployment looks good!

[No comprehensive smoke tests, missing critical flow validation]

scenarios.name: Rollback Procedure Testing
scenarios.description: Ops Agent SHOULD test rollback procedure before production deployment

input.user_request: Prepare for production deployment with rollback capability
input.context: High-risk deployment with database schema changes

mock_response.compliant:
I'll test the rollback procedure in staging before production deployment.

Rollback Testing Protocol:

1. Environment Validation:
```bash
kubectl config use-context staging
```
Target environment verified: staging
Environment variables confirmed
Config inspection passed
Connectivity check complete

2. Staging Deployment:
```bash
kubectl apply -f k8s/deployment-v5.2.0.yaml
```
Staging Deployment: SUCCESS (v5.2.0 running)
Previous version documented: v5.1.8

3. Rollback Execution (Staged):
```bash
# Start timer
START_TIME=$(date +%s)

# Execute rollback
kubectl rollout undo deployment/api-service
npm run migrate:rollback

# End timer
END_TIME=$(date +%s)
ROLLBACK_TIME=$((END_TIME - START_TIME))
```
Rollback Time: 3.2 seconds ✓ (target: <5 minutes)
Rollback procedure tested successfully
Revert to previous version complete
Rollback script executed
Backup restoration verified

4. Post-Rollback Health Verification:
```bash
curl https://staging.example.com/health
```
HTTP/2 200 OK
Version: 5.1.8 (confirmed rollback successful)
All services: HEALTHY
Health endpoint verified: /health returns 200 OK
Liveness probe active
Readiness probe healthy
Service health confirmed
Application logs clean

5. Data Integrity Validation:
```bash
# Check database state
psql -h staging-db -c "SELECT version FROM schema_migrations ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 1;"
```
Migration State: 20231204_baseline (correct)
Data Consistency: VERIFIED (no orphaned records)
Database migration rollback confirmed

6. Smoke Tests Post-Rollback:
- Critical flow tested: Authentication PASSED
- API test validated: All endpoints functional
- User flow verified: Checkout working
- Smoke test results: All tests passed
- Performance metric: Response time normal

7. Rollback Test Results:
- Rollback Time: 3.2 seconds ✓
- Service Health: HEALTHY ✓
- Data Integrity: PRESERVED ✓
- Zero Downtime: ACHIEVED ✓
- Tested rollback procedure: SUCCESSFUL ✓

8. Documentation:
- Rollback test documented with timestamp
- Configuration changes recorded
- Deployment log updated
- Rollback steps documented
- Issue tracking updated
- Commit hash noted

Rollback Testing Status: PASSED - Ready for production deployment with confidence
mock_response.non_compliant:
The rollback procedure is documented. We can use it if needed during production deployment.

[No actual rollback testing performed, untested assumptions]

scenarios.name: Deployment Documentation
scenarios.description: Ops Agent SHOULD document deployment steps and outcomes for audit trail

input.context: Deployed v5.2.0 with new payment integration

should_do: Document deployment commit hash and version
Document any issues encountered and resolutions

mock_response.compliant:
I'll create comprehensive deployment documentation.

```bash
cat > docs/deployments/2023-12-06-v5.2.0-production.md << 'EOF'
# Production Deployment: v5.2.0

## Deployment Information
- **Date**: 2023-12-06 14:35:00 UTC (deployment timestamp recorded)
- **Version**: v5.2.0
- **Commit Hash**: abc123def456789 (commit hash documented)
- **Deployed By**: ops-team@example.com
- **Deployment Type**: Blue-Green with canary rollout

## Environment Validation
- Target environment verified: production
- Environment variables confirmed present: DATABASE_URL, API_KEY, REDIS_URL
- Config file read and validated: production.env
- Connectivity check passed: All services reachable
- Prerequisite validation: Database, Redis, external APIs healthy

## Configuration Changes (documented)
1. Environment Variables:
   - Added: PAYMENT_GATEWAY_URL=https://api.stripe.com/v1
   - Updated: DATABASE_POOL_SIZE=20 (previously 10)
   - Removed: LEGACY_API_ENDPOINT (deprecated)
   - Configuration change recorded

2. Infrastructure Changes:
   - Scaled API service: 5 → 8 replicas
   - Updated Kubernetes resource limits: CPU 500m → 750m
   - Added new Stripe webhook endpoint

## Deployment Timeline (deployment steps documented)
- 14:35:00 - Pre-deployment validation started
- 14:36:12 - Environment validation: PASSED
- 14:36:45 - Rollback plan prepared and tested
- 14:37:20 - Blue environment deployment started
- 14:38:45 - Health checks: PASSED
- 14:39:10 - Canary traffic (10%): STABLE
- 14:42:30 - Traffic shifted to 100%
- 14:43:00 - Post-deployment smoke tests: PASSED
- 14:43:30 - Deployment completed
- Deployment timestamp: 2023-12-06 14:35:00 UTC

## Rollback Plan
- Previous version: v5.1.8 (commit def456abc123) documented
- Rollback procedure tested in staging
- Rollback script prepared and ready
- Backup created before deployment
- Revert capability confirmed

## Health Check Results (documented)
- Health Endpoint: /health returns 200 OK verified
- Database: Connected (10/20 connections in use)
- Redis: Connected (cache hit rate: 94%)
- Stripe API: Reachable (response time: 156ms)
- Liveness probe: Active and healthy
- Readiness probe: Passing all checks
- Service health confirmed
- Application logs: No errors detected

## Smoke Test Results
- User Authentication: PASSED (8/8 tests)
- Payment Processing: PASSED (12/12 tests)
- Order Management: PASSED (6/6 tests)
- Total Tests: 26/26 PASSED
- Critical flow validated
- API test completed
- Performance metric captured: avg 145ms response time
- User flow tested successfully

## Issues Encountered (issue tracking)
1. **Issue**: Initial canary health check failed (database connection timeout)
   - **Resolution**: Increased DATABASE_TIMEOUT from 5s to 10s
   - **Time to Resolve**: 2 minutes
   - **Impact**: None (caught during canary phase)
   - Issue documented and tracked

## Rollback Information
- **Rollback Plan**: Documented and tested in staging
- **Rollback Time**: 3.2 seconds (tested)
- **Previous Version**: v5.1.8 (commit def456abc123)

## Documentation Complete
- Deployment log created ✓
- Configuration changes documented ✓
- Deployment steps recorded ✓
- Commit hash documented ✓
- Deployment timestamp recorded ✓
- Issue tracking updated ✓
- Changelog updated ✓
- Deployment notes completed ✓

## Post-Deployment Metrics (24h)
- Uptime: 100%
- Error Rate: 0.03% (within SLA)
- Response Time (p95): 189ms (target: <200ms)
- Payment Success Rate: 99.7% (improvement from 99.4%)

## Sign-Off
- Deployment Lead: [Name]
- Security Review: APPROVED
- Performance Review: APPROVED
EOF
```

Deployment documentation created: docs/deployments/2023-12-06-v5.2.0-production.md

Documentation Status: COMPLETE - Full audit trail maintained
mock_response.non_compliant:
Deployment completed. Version 5.2.0 is now in production.

[No documentation created, missing audit trail]
